column5: Difference between lund seats and their pro seats with airride suspension substantial? Ordered regular seats for my boat, not too sure if I should reconsider and upgrade, thanks. Its for a lund impact.
The reg seats are comfy but the air ride would be really nice on rough days I have had a few spine crushers in the rough stuff and the air ride would have helped .
the lund airride isn't as good as some of the aftermarket makes but it ain't bad...... and it does make a difference
Lund doesn't make them.. they are either Atwoods or Springfields. I have both in my boat. The rear seats are Atwoods. Front captains the other.
I'm sure Brunswick probably owns both companies Terry !!

Srt8, I'm assuming the reg seats are fixed as in they don't raise/lower? Never really paid attention. Me being young am not worried one bit if its a rough ride. Just looking out for my dad. If someone else  manufactures lunds pedestals, without the upgrade I could buy the springfield pedestal, I'd just be without the lund pro seats right? Hard decision, the boat itself costs enough, you could continously be upgrading lol.
yeah   all I know a buddy had factory air seats in a lund one broke he got an aftermarket **something* Glide it was called and it was twice the seat of the original one

yes aftermarket are way cheaper and you can mount your lund seats on them,The regular seats are just swivel but the impact I saw at the show had nicer seats than my rebel could have been upgades though

Ok that's good to know. From what I've heard the reg lund seats are comfy, I think later on ill get the aftermarket pedestal, since I also heard the lund air pedestals only last 2-3 years. Thanks for the help!
Here are some aftermarket options.  http://shockmasterpedestals.com/  http://www.smoothmovesseats.com/
